body:
To expand upon what some others have said:  We'll never know why the mother decided to start it, but once the brother learned the truth, he also realized that things would change once the sister got better.  She'd be going to school regularly, presumably make and spend time with friends, and generally be less reliant on him; or at least, that's how he perceives the situation.  And because he's afraid of losing the current relationship he has with her (whether that's just the sex, or the fact that she's almost totally reliant on him now that their mother is going to prison), he decides to let her keep taking the medicine in order to preserve the status quo for even just a little bit longer.  It's most likely out of fear, rather than malice.

Of course it's still fucked up, but that's just Ichihaya; there's almost always some strain of tragedy or weirdness at play in the story.  And for those who are curious, there's a mini followup story under /226728/ from the sister's perspective.

Hey for people who reading this, if you don't want to bad ending just don't read chapter 21 and above, or you can  read untill chapter 22 to know the truth, and for chapter 23, don't read chapter 23 because there is something you don't need to know to be read

For me he said that at the end because he doesn't want to lose her, he thinks that if she get's better it'll end, not only sex but all things they do, now they're lovers. I'm not saying it's good, he's egocentrical he thinks about himself not his sister, but it isn't that he wants to kill her, or he just wants sex. Just wanted to point that
